title: Like James Cracknell, I know what it's like to be a Strictly first round loser when you're used to winning
text:
For an elite sportsman, a desire to excel at everything you do pretty much comes with the territory. Fortunately for us then, we generally have a chance to keep trying until we achieve.

The same approach does not always work when competing in other arenas. On being booted off Strictly Come Dancing at the weekend, rowing champion James Cracknell has discovered as much - to his great disappointment, I’d imagine.

I know just how he must be feeling. In 2015, I too became the first celebrity contestant from my intake to be voted off the BBC talent contest. I won’t pretend it didn’t come as a shock. I knew I was not the best of dancers, but my overriding thought as a sportsman was, “Just give me one...
description: For an elite sportsman, a desire to excel at everything you do pretty much comes with the territory.
